resources.string: Kernel Audio and Media Flinger App
Ultra High Quality Audio is active
Ultra High Quality Audio is not active
UHQA mode allows to have high performance audio when using headset at primary. turn off/on UHQA to switch the amplifier for HPH path.
Ultra High Quality Audio feature is not available in your kernel.
Headset High Performance Mode is active
Headset High Performance Mode is not active
Invoke class AB mode for headset path when sample rate is set to 192KHz and bit depth is set to 24. Enable it to set headset path in UHQA mode.
Headset High Performance feature is not available in your kernel.
Low Distortion AMP is not active
Provide low distortion audio quality by enable/disable AB Class Mode directly on amplifier from the kernel.
Low Distortion AMP feature is not available in your kernel.
Headphone Impedance Detection is not active
Provide impedance of headphones to be able to adjust gain according to impedance, so user can have consistent volume level with different headphones.
Headphone Impedance Detection feature is not available in your kernel.
NOTE: Experimental features can make problem with audio process if you are use some service that need exclusive access like BiQuads service or other.
Qualcomm power gating features is only useful if user want to use BiQuads filter, it should save power for other users. (Active it if you want to use BiQuads)

ALSA Info is application that can control current exist audio features on kernel directly and show current audio media flinger status that running on device when play a song or not from audioserver service on android.
This app is work by using shell command that will dump active android mediaflinger from system and sort it by category then detect it each current state.
This app should work on android 10.0 with latest Android Audio API, not sure for older Android Audio API from android below than Android 10.0 .
Application is only for personal use
